results.title: Creating a dance (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The first part of the film traces stages in the creation of a demonstration of dance movement, examining the constituent parts and illustrating how the solutions to some of the associated problems were evolved. The second part presents the entire demonstration without comment. Dance direction and narration by Valerie Preston-Dunlop.

results.title: Creating
results.creator_credit: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program looks at the world of contemporary Chinese art, exploring the philosophic and historic influences that shape it. The way that Chinese artists pursue the essence of “reality” is examined as are the techniques which combine traditional values with unconventional materials to produce works that are resplendently Chinese.

results.title: Created equal
results.creator_credit: Graham Massey, Michael Latham and Video Arts
results.brief_description: Milton Friedman discusses freedom and equality, arguing that a society which maximises the scope for individual choice and action will be more successful at creating equal opportunities for all than a society which seeks to achieve quality through distribution of wealth.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Graham Massey, Michael Latham and Video Arts

results.title: Crazy Rich Asians
results.brief_description: An American-born Chinese economics professor accompanies her boyfriend to Singapore for his best friend’s wedding, only to get thrust into the lives of Asia’s rich and famous.

constellations_other.name: The Family Law
constellations_other.description: An exploration of Asian representation on screens around the world that delves into TV, cinema, documentaries and Disney princesses.

results.title: Crazy in Alabama
results.creator_credit: Antonio Banderas, Linda Goldstein Knowlton, Meir Teper and Green Moon Productions
results.brief_description: The events which unfold during the summer of 1965 prove to be a turning point in the life of 13-year-old Peejoe (Lucas Black). His simple existence is turned upside down by his Aunt Lucille (Melanie Griffith), who calmly confesses to the murder of her abusive husband then hops into her car and heads for Hollywood, determined to pursue her dream of becoming an actress. Peejoe and his brother are sent to stay with uncle Dove (David Morse), a funeral director in the small town where the boys first truly experience the division between the white and black communities. The tension caused by this situation erupts when Peejoe witnesses the racist Sheriff Doggett (Meat Loaf Aday) cause the death of a young black boy during a protest over racial segregation at the local pool. The theme of madness constantly surfaces in the narrative, with the more bizarre aspects of Lucille’s adventure juxtaposed against the irrationality of the segregation laws operating in the town at the time. The plot reaches a climax when these two types of madness collide, forcing the town to confront the darker side of human nature and examine the true meaning of insanity. “Crazy in Alabama” is the directorial debut of actor Antonio Banderas, most recognised for his appearances in the early films of Pedro Almodovar, and his more recent work in Hollywood.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Antonio Banderas, Linda Goldstein Knowlton, Meir Teper and Green Moon Productions

results.title: Crayon
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the wide techniques which may be used in working with crayons - notching, scratching, rubbing, grating and melting. Drawing can be on paper, wood, metal, glass and fabric. Shows artists creating brilliantly coloured and textures work.

results.title: Crayfish for Julie
results.brief_description: Depicts a day in the life of a fisherman catching crayfish off the coast near Fremantle, Western Australia. Briefly traces the growth and development of the crayfish industry. Made with the co operation of the Department of Fisheries Western Australia. Narrated by Clive Winmill.

results.title: Crayfish coast
results.creator_credit: Conon Fraser, Derek Wright and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: The isolated crayfishing settlement of Ngawi is at the eastern end of Cook Strait. This film looks at the livelihood of the crayfishermen and their families in the small stark settlement.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Conon Fraser, Derek Wright and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: Cray season
results.creator_credit: Rodney Musch, Don Anderson and Tasmanian State Film Unit
results.brief_description: The crayfish, seen not as a table delicacy, but as a living creature whose survival is threatened. Briefly looks at its life history, its vulnerability, its predators, and man its greatest enemy. Feild researchers take the camera underwater to the world of ‘Janus Lalander’, the southern crayfish.
